intro: Koanophyllon pseudoperfoliatum, commonly known as the false leafy dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of many small florets. The plant has basal leaves that are typically lobed or toothed, and its flowers are yellow, arranged in a composite head. It is often found in rocky or disturbed soils, thriving in arid to semi-arid environments. The species is noted for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions, making it a hardy plant in its native range.
